org.jcvi.jillion.trace.fastq

Class FastqWriterBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvi.jillion.trace.fastq.FastqWriterBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Builder<FastqWriter>

    public final class FastqWriterBuilder
extends Object
implements Builder<FastqWriter>
    FastqWriterBuilder is a Builder that builds an instance of FastqWriter.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Constructor Detail

      • FastqWriterBuilder

        public FastqWriterBuilder(OutputStream out)
        Create a new FastqWriterBuilder that will use the given OutputStream to write out the fastq records.
        Parameters:
        out - the OutputStream to use; can not be null.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if out is null.

      • FastqWriterBuilder

        public FastqWriterBuilder(File outputFile)
                   throws IOException
        Create a new FastqWriterBuilder that will use the given File to write out the fastq records. Any contents that previously existed in this file will be overwritten. If the path for the given File does not yet exist, then it will be created. Since 5.3, if the file extension is either ".gz" or ".zip" then the writer will automatically compress the output for you.
        Parameters:
        outputFile - the File to use; can not be null.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if outputFile is null.
        IOException - if there is a problem creating the new file. or cannot be opened for any other reason.

    • Method Detail

      • charset

        public FastqWriterBuilder charset(Charset charset)
        Change the Charset used to write out the fasta record. If this method is not called, then the CharSet will default to UTF-8.
        Parameters:
        charset - the Charset to use; can not be null.
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if charset is null.

      • qualityCodec

        public FastqWriterBuilder qualityCodec(FastqQualityCodec codec)
        Change the method that quality values are encoded by providing a FastqQualityCodec implementation. If this method is not called, this writer will default to FastqQualityCodec.SANGER.
        Parameters:
        codec - the FastqQualityCodec to use when writing out the encoded quality sequence; can not be null.
        Returns:
        this. Throws NullPointerException if codec is null.

      • duplicateIdOnQualityDefLine

        public FastqWriterBuilder duplicateIdOnQualityDefLine()
        If this method is called then the id of the fastq records will be duplicated on the fastq quality deflines. This is not recommended since it will usually add several megabytes to the file size and only contain duplicate data. (The id of the record will also be on the nucleotide sequence defline).
        Returns:
        this.

      • adapt

        public FastqWriterBuilder adapt(Function<FastqRecord,FastqRecord> adapterFunction)
        Wrap the built FastqWriter wrap the given fastqWriter and intercept any calls to write() to allow the record to be transformed in some way. For example, to change the id or modify or trim the sequences; or even skip the record entirely. Calling this method multiple times will overwrite the adaptation not nest additional adapters. If you need to do that make several calls to FastqWriter.adapt(FastqWriter, Function)
        Parameters:
        adapterFunction - a Function that is given the input FastqRecord to be written and will return a possibly new FastqRecord to actually write. If the function returns null then the record is skipped. If this parameter is null, then no adapter will be used as if this method was never called at all.
        Returns:
        this
        Since:
        5.3
        See Also:
        FastqWriter.adapt(FastqWriter, Function)

      • basesPerLine

        public FastqWriterBuilder basesPerLine(int basesPerLine)
        Change the number of bases per line to write for each fastq record. If this method is not called, then then the each nucleotide and quality sequence will be written out on one line each.
        Parameters:
        basesPerLine - the basesPerLine to use must be >=1.
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if basesPerLine <1.

      • sortInMemoryOnly

        public FastqWriterBuilder sortInMemoryOnly(Comparator<FastqRecord> comparator)
        Write out the FastqRecords written by this writer sorted by the specified Comparator but do all the sorting in memory. All of the records will be cached in memory so the output can be written sorted when the Closeable.close() method is called. It is not recommended to use this method if a large number of records will be written because an OutOfMemoryError may occur.
        Parameters:
        comparator - the Comparator to use to sort the FastqRecords; can not be null.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if comparator is null.
        Since:
        5.0

      • sort

        public FastqWriterBuilder sort(Comparator<FastqRecord> comparator)
        Write out the FastqRecords written by this writer sorted by the specified Comparator using a combination of in memory sorting and writing out sorted temporary files. With a default number of records to keep in memory at any time. (Currently 10,000 records).

        This is the same as sort(comparator, 10_000) which uses the default temp area to make temp files.

        Parameters:
        comparator - the Comparator to use to sort the FastqRecords; can not be null.
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if comparator is null.
        Since:
        5.3
        See Also:
        sort(Comparator, int), sort(Comparator, int, File), sortInMemoryOnly(Comparator)

      • sort

        public FastqWriterBuilder sort(Comparator<FastqRecord> comparator,
                               int inMemoryCacheSize)
        Write out the FastqRecords written by this writer sorted by the specified Comparator using a combination of in memory sorting and writing out sorted temporary files.

        This is the same as sort(comparator, inMemCacheSize, null) which uses the default temp area to make temp files.

        Parameters:
        comparator - the Comparator to use to sort the FastqRecords; can not be null.
        inMemoryCacheSize - the in memory cache size to use; must be positive.
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if comparator is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if inMemoryCacheSize < 1.
        Since:
        5.0

      • sort

        public FastqWriterBuilder sort(Comparator<FastqRecord> comparator,
                               int inMemoryCacheSize,
                               File dir)
        Write out the FastqRecords written by this writer sorted by the specified Comparator using a combination of in memory sorting and writing out sorted temporary files. An in memory cache similar of the specified size will be created and whenever the cache fills, the sorted cache contents will be written to a temp file in the specified tmpDir and the cache cleared out to make room for more records to write. There may be multiple temp files written depending on how many FastqRecords are passed to the Writer. Once Closeable.close() has been called, the contents of the in memory cache, and any temp files written out are merged and written sorted to the final output file.

        If any files get written to temp files under dir, they will be deleted when the writer is closed. However dir itself will not be deleted so feel free to provide non-temp directories as well.

        Parameters:
        comparator - the Comparator to use to sort the FastqRecords; can not be null.
        inMemoryCacheSize - the in memory cache size to use; must be positive.
        dir - the directory to write files to; if set to null then the default system temporary directory is used. If the value is not null, then it must be a directory that already exists.
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if comparator is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if inMemoryCacheSize < 1, or if a non-null dir does not exist or is not a directory.
        Since:
        5.0

      • build

        public FastqWriter build()
        Description copied from interface: Builder
        Create a new instance using the data collected by this builder thus far.
